reviewText: I really like this one from Sara Ivanhoe.  I feel like I've gotten a good stretching workout when it is complete. I would not call it "hard", but it is intense enough to feel like I've worked many muscles.
A really good workout for you who do yoga, and wants  to do more (read; harder) yoga. Try it if you want more out of your yoga
This is just a series of Sun Salutations. Which is ok if you just want to do a series of Sun Salutations, and Sarah is a great instructor with great personality, but I got bored with it.

This was filmed in a brightly lit studio with two other instructors, but Sara is definitely the leader here. It has upbeat non-traditional yoga music, which I find energizing as it is easy to dance to it while listening to instructions. It is not the most soothing for the final relaxation pose though. I would suggest it is best to practice to this video in the morning. Vinyasas and sun salutations are pretty similar to Sara's other videos. She loves chair pose and plank pose (as do I). I could definitely feel this one in my quadriceps after the practice. Sara also adds a nice twist to one of the routines by moving into a standing splits, which was fun. She really concentrates on leading students through breathing for each movement. Another nice feature is on-screen graphics to reinforce pose names in English and Sanskrit. If you haven't experienced Sara's down to earth, go easy on yourself style, I would recommend starting with her Sara Ivanhoe's Yoga Body Makeover Series and also her beautiful Yoga on the Edge - Sara Ivanhoe. After using these two outdoor (Hawaii and Bahamas) DVDs, it is tough to go back inside the studio, but Sara's sparkling personality is worth it in this one. Namaste!
